mcmcderive 0.0.0.9004
  • Reference

mcmcderive

Introduction

mcmcderive is an R package to generate derived parameters from Monte Carlo Markov Chain (MCMC) samples using R code. The derived parameters are returned as an mcmcr object.

The mcmcderive package also provides the R equivalent to functions such as

  • pow()
  • phi()
  • log() <-
  • logit() <-

that often occur in template model code.

Demonstration

library(mcmcderive)

mcmcr::mcmcr_example
#> $alpha
#> [1] 3.718025 4.718025
#> 
#> nchains:  2 
#> niters:  400 
#> 
#> $beta
#>           [,1]     [,2]
#> [1,] 0.9716535 1.971654
#> [2,] 1.9716535 2.971654
#> 
#> nchains:  2 
#> niters:  400 
#> 
#> $sigma
#> [1] 0.7911975
#> 
#> nchains:  2 
#> niters:  400

expr <- "
  log(alpha2) <- alpha
  gamma <- sum(alpha) * sigma
"

mcmc_derive(mcmcr::mcmcr_example, expr)
#> $alpha2
#> [1]  41.18352 111.94841
#> 
#> nchains:  2 
#> niters:  400 
#> 
#> $gamma
#> [1] 6.60742
#> 
#> nchains:  2 
#> niters:  400

Installation

To install the latest development version from the Poisson drat repository

# install.packages("drat")
drat::addRepo("poissonconsulting")
install.packages("mcmcderive")
